image.altText: The referee signals 10 to send Canberra Raiders' Hudson Young to the sin bin in an NRL game.

title.children: Defence minister says families of veteran suicide will be left 'unheard' as royal commission won't be extended

image.altText: Spencer Leniu points to the sky during Sydney Rooster-Brisbane Broncos NRL match in Las Vegas.

image.altText: A man with tattoos wearing a red t-shirt and a baseball cap stares at the camera.

image.altText: A building site in the forest.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's outgoing president is leaving his utopian vision for a jungle capital to his successors to build. Will they pull the plug?

image.altText: Black and white image of a woman wearing a dress in the foreground, old brick buildings and hand written papers in background.

props.synopsis: Until the late 1960s, abortion was illegal in Australia. With limited access to contraception, many women, like my great-grandmother, unlawfully attempted to terminate unwanted pregnancies.

title.children: My great-grandmother was just 36 when she died but before she did she had to hide the cause from police

image.altText: Rust movie armourer Hannah Gutierrez-Reed.

title.children: Jury finds armourer guilty of involuntary manslaughter in fatal shooting on set of Alec Baldwin movie Rust

image.altText: The Tesla brand logo.

props.synopsis: Tesla quits the national car lobby, saying it has deceived customers over the government's proposed CO2 scheme for vehicles.

image.altText: A red panda peeks out of a wicker basket after it was found by Thai customs.

props.synopsis: Thai customs officials arrest six people for attempting to smuggle a red panda and 86 other animals out of the kingdom, including snakes, parrots and monitor lizards, officials say.

image.altText: Close up of a crocodile's eye

title.children: A family came within metres of a crocodile in a swimming hole. So why didn't it attack?

image.altText: A man from an Air Force search team in a headset looks out a plane window looking at the ocean.

props.synopsis: Searches costing $200 million were unable to locate flight MH370, but investigators are hopeful new technology and techniques will lead to the missing plane and solve the 10-year-old aviation mystery.Â
